In Section 2,we define the total Segre class of a cone and introduce a generalized
version of double point formula. This formula allows us to compute the total Segre
in order to determine the degree of the 3-secant variety. However,
the singularity of the 2-secant variety may impede this computation. To overcome this
issue, we introduce the notion of higher very ampleness of a line bundle
bundle in Section 3. We take the secant bundle as a nonsingular birational model for the
